channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Dumped soil outside 27 Wilderton Road N16 Hackney, 22nd August
item.description:
This dumped soil has been here for 2 weeks, this could be contaminated, causing illnesses to residents, Hackney council needs to do something about this immediately. Also obstructing parking, for public .

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Wilderton Road, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Palm tree over grown, 22nd August
item.description:
Over grown palm tree that over the fenche tree hanging out when passing pavement, branches touching tenants window n 388 bus window i know hackney not intrested off prune this tree come round ask number 1 banbury house to prune it pls

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Banbury Road, Hackney, London

item.title: Pavements on upper Clapton (Ladbrokes), 22nd August
item.description:
Drug users the last two years from chicken shop up to traffic lights full of crack users sitting outside our local shops, I freed walking with my 7 year old they way the pounce on people for money and follow many people in to our local shops begging us to buy them beers or demanding money.. They urinate up against walls of Ladbrokes and bus stops, walk bare footed and the whole pavements on upper Clapton from chicken hut towards Springfield are really disgusting and we deserve a hygiene clean or jet washing of our public space when on our travels especially with our very young children.. A suggestion of potted flowers also to brighten up our high road would make people appreciate our community..in fourth three years no flowers for surroundings..which brings alsorts of druggies hounding us locals as we try to go to work, popping to shops or taking our children to school.. Please please bring upper Clapton some nice flowers and a pavements a hygiene clean especially in the summer times.. Help your hard workers and parents of upper Clapton high road get rid of the slum it has slowly become Regards
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Upper Clapton Road, Clapton, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: As shown on the map, one of the street lights is not working., 22nd August
item.description:

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): South Carriage Drive, Knightsbridge, London

item.title: Estate street lighting inoperative for weeks, 22nd August
item.description:
Multiple street lighting inside GoldCrest Mews estate from 2-9 House GoldCrest Mews - street lights are inoperative and is very dark at night and can’t even see where walking. Please can these lights be fixed so the estate can be bright for visibility
Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Maury Road, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Weeds growing, rubbish everywhere, smells bad 2rats running around, 22nd August
item.description:
There are weeds growing from the curbs & on the pavement, rubbish all over the place empty cans & bags blowing around, bins have rubbish dumped outside of them I have just seen 2rats running up and down and a mouse or it is a baby rat run in a crack to somebody’s house The smell and look of this road is unacceptable can you send someone around to clean it up ,this road needs daily cleaning is there not cleaners around there because I have never seen one and none of my neighbours have either and we all go past there on a daily basis to go to the bus stop and back home This road has been neglected for a very long time now and we have had enough Please can it have a good clean
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 1, New Church Road, Camberwell, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Update Double Yellow Curb Markings, 22nd August
item.description:
Please arrange for the curbs to be marked with double yellow lines to stop this repeat offender from parking and obstructing the driveways. We have put out cones and he moves them 4 days a week then parks using a disabled badge with no signs of a disability. Then proceeds to jog in CPFC Academy site. Residents are few up and have been waiting 8 months for the lines to marked on the curb!

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Copers Cope Road, New Beckenham, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: No Stopping Signs, 21st August
item.description:
Please arrange the no stopping at anytime signs for the double yellow lines on Copers Cope Road. We have people abusing the disability badges for CPFC Academy parking most days!
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Copers Cope Road, New Beckenham, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Bins being used to block parking, 21st August
item.description:
4 bins have been placed in the road outside 17 and 15 Percy Road to stop anyone parking there for at least 2 weeks, and taking up space for at least 3 cars. As the residents have to pay for the privilege to park here in marked bays - some of whom are elderly and/or have disabilities - this is unfair. I understand that building supplies deliveries need to be made but I've only witnessed 2 in the past week, so having these spaces out of action for 2 whole weeks is unacceptable.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Percy Road, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Crystal Palace Park Road SE26 on the north side of L, 21st August
item.description:
Crystal Palace Park Road SE26 on the north side of Lawrie Park Road traffic island central pole light has two polycarbonate flyposters attached with zip tied to it. item.title: Inappropriate location and use of commercial food and waste bins and refuse, 21st August
item.description:
Hello A new business is using the pavement to store its commercial waste wheelie bins . They are on the street at all times and are full of food waste and attracting fly tipping and general misuse by passers by. They are also blocking the pavement from proper use. These bins should be stored inside the business premises not on the street, they are unsightly, unhygienic and promoting general bad behaviour in the alley including dog and human fouling. The issue has been going on for the past month or so, I have already made one complaint amd not received any feedback or seen any improvement or action. Please see photo as it describes the situation but does not illustrate that pedestrians are forced into the road to pass this corner now or that a wheelchair user could not use this pavement . This urgently needs to be addressed with the business owner and the bins moved or removed.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Shand Street, The Borough, London
Report on FixMyStreet
